headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SEIDEN, MELVIN R.

docs.lead_paragraph: SEIDEN--Melvin R. The Trustees and staff of The Children's Aid Society of New York mourn the passing of beloved Board member and friend Melvin R. Seiden. A Trustee for 36 years, Mel was a champion of underserved children and families. He was a dedicated, caring and committed trustee and one of our most active committee members. A former Chair of the Audit Committee, most recently Mel served on the Pension and Personnel, the Finance and Investment and the Health Services committees of the Board of Trustees. He was a major supporter of our work. Mel's extraordinarily thoughtful and generous support made it possible for us to establish our Obesity Prevention Program. He also supported our Foster Care program, Wagon Road Camp, Chorus program and Alvin Ailey Camp program. Our hearts go out to his wife Janine Luke, also a longtime friend and benefactor to Children's Aid, and the rest of his family. He will be sorely missed at Children's Aid by all who knew him. Mark M. Edmiston, Chairman Richard R. Buery, Jr., President and CEO

headline.main: On the Border, Long Lives Despite Dismal Statistics

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite low incomes, health coverage and high school graduation, Hidalgo County residents live two years longer than the United States or Texas averages.
